org.cs3.pl.prolog
Interface LifeCycleHook

All Known Subinterfaces:
LifeCycleHook2
public interface LifeCycleHook

hook into the PIFs lifecycle.

Method Summary
 void afterInit(PrologInterface pif)
          called by the PrologInterface after the startup is complete.

Method Detail

onInit

public void onInit(PrologInterface pif,
                   PrologSession initSession)
            throws PrologInterfaceException
called by the PrologInterface during startup phase.
This method executes on the same thread that starts the prolog interface. No interaction via regular PrologSessions will take place before this method is called on all registered LifeCycleHooks.
Important Note: Only access the pif through the initSession argument. In particular, take care that this method does not indirectly trigger a call to PrologInterface.getSession() on the same thread, or you will very propably couse a dead lock. The initial session cannot be disposed.

Parameters:
initSession - safe-mode session for startup phase.
Throws:
PrologInterfaceException

afterInit

public void afterInit(PrologInterface pif)
               throws PrologInterfaceException
called by the PrologInterface after the startup is complete.
This method executes asynchronously to the thread that started the prolog interface. By the time it is called, the pif is guaranteed to be up and ready for normal operation (getSession() and friends).

Throws:
PrologInterfaceException

beforeShutdown

public void beforeShutdown(PrologInterface pif,
                           PrologSession session)
                    throws PrologInterfaceException
called by the PrologInterface before the pif shuts down.
This method is called on the same thread that stops the prolog interface. There are no other sessions running. (FIXME verify this!!)
Important Note: Only access the pif through the initSession argument. In particular, take care that this method does not indirectly trigger a call to PrologInterface.getSession() on the same thread, or you will very propably couse a dead lock. The cleanup session cannot be disposed.

Throws:
PrologInterfaceException
